alert.note: Alert for Banner; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 6:16PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Scotts Bluff and northwestern Banner Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 516 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Harrisburg, or 18 miles southwest of Scottsbluff, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Harrisburg around 545 PM MDT. Wildcat Hills Campground around 550 PM MDT. Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area around 555 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
